messages.message: Thanks for the feedback. I think before we do the next round of feedback we should run an enablement session on the differences between the ai lab prototype & the chat and build mode in ai hub. but the 2 modes are quite different now. the sandbox is also pretty outdated.

Understood, that would be helpful Kerry. 

I think primarily, the fact that the wheel spins and nothing comes back until an error after about 3 minutes is a poor end-user experience. 

Additionally, I think from an output/results perspective, the old ai-labs sandbox produces significantly better outputs than anything I’ve seen returned by the AIHub Dev sandbox. 

(But with the known long docs limitation)

But the comparison I refer to in the first ticket is in chat mode on both ai-labs and ai-hub-dev. 

I think if there are significant differences in the kind of results returned by chat and build modes, we’ll need to make it really clear to the end-user that they should expect a different experience
Intuitively (without any enablement or guidance), one would expect the 2 modes to produce similar results based on the same prompts.
@Kerry is there a way to know what environment is the latest? @Varun Jain

@Matt Weaver thanks for the feedback. We are working on creating a stable staging ENV with all the improvements merged in last week. This will be shared as part of internal preview this week.

@Kerry we have scheduled enablement sessions for both the technical and broader field team this week. I’ll share the content for your inputs. We’re planning to cover the capabilities and limitations across the various modes in the session.
